{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pharyngeal arches are structures seen in the embryonic development of vertebrates. They are derived from all three germ layers: the endoderm, ectoderm, and mesoderm. The endoderm forms the innermost layer, the ectoderm forms the outermost layer, and the mesoderm forms the middle layer. Therefore, the pharyngeal arches are a thickening of all three layers.", "answer_choice": "D. All of the above."}
